Detailed Description

Specific implementation of the OnOffTool class, with the assumtpion that the OnOffTool is controlled by one digital channel.

The OnOffTool functions on() and off() control the OnOffTool through the digital channel. The digital channel can be specified in the global configuration file.

Example Program: 

//======================================================================== 
// Project: Robotic Platform
// ---------------------------------------------------------------------- 
// Package: End Effector Classes 
// Authors:   Vijayakrishna Basettihalli
// Start Date: Fri Jun 08 06:12:46 GMT 2001
// ----------------------------------------------------------------------  
// File: DefaultOnOffTool.t.cpp
// Example program for the class DefaultOnOffTool.
//========================================================================  
 

// ----- Standard Libaries -----
#include <iostream.h>
#include <conio.h>


// ----- QRTS Libraries -----

// ----- Project Includes -----
#include "RoboticPlatform.hpp"
#include "DefaultOnOffTool.hpp"

//======================================================================== 
// main
//========================================================================  
 
int main(int argc, char *argv[])
{
  
  RoboticPlatform::init(argc, argv);
  
  DefaultOnOffTool onofftool;
  cout << "created object" << endl;
  onofftool.setSimulationModeOn();
  if (onofftool.d_objectStatus.isStatusError()) 
  {
    cout << onofftool.d_objectStatus.getMessageText() << endl;
  }
  
  cout << "Menu: " << endl;
  cout << " \t[n] On" <<endl;
  cout << " \t[f] Off" <<endl;
  cout << " \t[q] Quit" <<endl;
  char ch;
  
  while ((ch=getch()) != 'q') 
  {
    if (ch=='n')
      onofftool.on();
    else
      if (ch=='f')
        onofftool.off();
      
  }
  
  
  
  RoboticPlatform::exit();            
  return 0;
}

Constructor & Destructor Documentation

DefaultOnOffTool ( const char * objectName )
 

This constructor allows you to specify the object name. If the section in the global configuration file specified by the object name has the class name "DefaultOnOffTool", then the settings of this section are used to setup the object.

Parameters:
objectName   Object name, identical with the section name in the global configuration file.

DefaultOnOffTool ( int numInConfig = 1 )
 

This constructor allows you to specify the number of the object in the global configuration file that specifies the class name "DefaultOnOffTool". The settings of this object in the global configuration are used to setup the object.

Parameters:
numInConfig   Number of the object in the global configuration file (only objects of the correct class type are counted), starting at "1".

DefaultOnOffTool ( const TypeInfo * parent ) [protected]
 

The constructor initializes class variables. This constructor is only called from a derived class.

bool isOn ( ) [virtual]
 

Determines if the OnOffTool is on.

Returns:
true: If the OnOffTool is on.
false: If the OnOffTool is off.

Reimplemented from OnOffTool.

void setSimulationModeOn ( ) [virtual]
 

Reimplemented from class PhysicalObject. Sets simulation mode on and switches off hardware control.

Reimplemented from PhysicalObject.

void setSimulationModeOff ( ) [virtual]
 

Reimplemented from class PhysicalObject. Sets simulation mode off and starts hardware control.

Reimplemented from PhysicalObject.

void readGlobalConfiguration ( Config * config ) [virtual]
 

Reimplemented from class PhysicalObject. Reads in entries for digital channel to control the OnOffTool, control values and name of I/O server to connect to.

Reimplemented from PhysicalObject.
